library.name: A Comprehensive Bibliography on Syriac Studies

bib: Albalaa, Pierre Youssef. “Light Used as Metaphor in the Prologue of the Fourth Gospel: The Influence of This Metaphor on the Maronite ‘Prayer of the Faithful.’” M.Th. thesis, University of South Africa, 2008.
citation: Pierre Youssef Albalaa, “Light Used as Metaphor in the Prologue of the Fourth Gospel: The Influence of This Metaphor on the Maronite ‘Prayer of the Faithful’” (M.Th. thesis, University of South Africa, 2008).

data.title: Light Used as Metaphor in the Prologue of the Fourth Gospel: The Influence of this Metaphor on the Maronite “Prayer of the Faithful”
data.abstractNote: In this dissertation, the affinities between the Prologue of the Fourth Gospel and the Maronite Prayer of the Faithful especially the use of light metaphor are examined and new hypothetic proposals are suggested: the former has influenced the latter; both of them might have shared the same milieu or have been influenced by an existent Antiochene liturgical hymn. These proposals are discussed according to reflections on the Fourth Gospel, the Antiochene Syriac Maronite Church, the light metaphor, to the work done on the Prologue from a socio-rhetorical perspective and to the study conducted on the first English edition of the Maronite Prayer of the Faithful .

citation: Isaac Alencherry, An Eastern Theology of Priesthood: A Study Based on the Rite of Presbyteral Ordination in the Chaldean and Syro-Malabar Church (New Delhi: Intercultural Publications, 1994).

data.title: An Eastern Theology of Priesthood: A Study Based on the Rite of Presbyteral Ordination in the Chaldean and Syro-Malabar Church
data.abstractNote: The first section outlines the historical and liturgical setting for the eastern practice of ordination. The second and longer section discusses the theology of priesthood, with chapters on "The priesthood of Christ", "The Election of the Church and the Ecclesiastical Ministry", "The Grace and the Talents of Priesthood", and "Priestly Ministry: Functional Facts". With appendixes explaining terms and presenting documents, a bibliography and an index.
